page.title: 11SCHOOLS
page.content: There are 199 pupils in Lenham Primary School.Situated next to the Primary is a secondary school,there are 840 pupils attending the secondary school,74 of them are taking their 'O'levels in the summer and there are only seven 6th formers but next year there will be twenty. Children come from five surrounding villages to Swadelands.For the first two years in Swadelands it is a comprehensive school. It is known as a High School. Children from 13 plus are selected to go to Grammar Schools. The Primary School was built in 1951. The secondary school was first a large house but then new blocks were added. Both schools are pleasantly situated with trees and playing fields.
